title: How much would a giant squid cost to purchase? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well Eddie, I really don’t know, but let’s guesstimate here. On average as seafood, a six pound whole squid sells for ~ $40.00. In the giant squid genus, Architeuthis the male can easily weigh 440 lbs. while the female can reach a ton, which is 2000 lbs. So, with all this in mind and a bit of math factoring, I’d say a male squid would cost ya $2933.33, while a one ton female would be a whopping $133,333.33. Of course this is not including the labor that went into the process of deep sea fishing for the cephalopod and hauling it back to shore.

Oh I guess you'd need to win a mega lottery first before even considering that! The housing alone could run you into the millions or billions of dollars. Plus the price of the upkeep. I'm guessing you'd need at least 1/3 of the world's oceans to make a suitable home. Then the feed? You'd need to buy a few whales, sharks and dolphins to keep your dear Architeuthis happy and well fed. Then you'd have to find a way to feed it. Maybe you might lose your life to the Teuthis’ huge building sized beak! Lol
